e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it promotes transparency and accuracy in financial reporting. Although some investors may initially adjust their expectations, this shift will ultimately lead to a more realistic valuation of the company. Additionally, adopting an unbiased policy reduces potential legal liability and aligns with generally accepted accounting principles. While there may be short-term market fluctuations, the long-term benefits of transparent reporting outweigh these concerns.
e5: I consider a reporting policy ethical if it is transparent, accurate, and unbiased. This means providing stakeholders with complete and reliable information, free from manipulation or misrepresentation. An ethical reporting policy promotes trust, accountability, and informed decision-making. In the context of financial reporting, additional considerations include compliance with relevant regulations and accounting standards, as well as consistency in application to facilitate comparability. Ultimately, an ethical reporting policy prioritizes fairness, honesty, and integrity, even if it requires short-term sacrifices or adjustments.
e6: Yes, I would have several follow-up questions for the management team. Firstly, what is the proposed timeline for implementing the new policy and how will stakeholders be notified? Secondly, what measures will be taken to ensure a smooth transition and minimize potential disruptions to the market or investor relations? Additionally, how will the company address any concerns or questions from investors or analysts regarding the change in reporting policy? Lastly, are there any plans to provide additional guidance or support to help stakeholders understand and adjust to the new policy?
